summary: Vatican City is the smallest independent country in the world, located within Rome, Italy. It became a separate state in 1929 and is ruled by the Pope, the leader of the Catholic Church. With a population of around 764, it's also the least populated capital. The Vatican is home to important religious sites like St. Peter's Basilica and the Sistine Chapel, as well as museums and libraries with valuable art. Its economy relies on donations, souvenir sales, and admission fees.
title: Vatican City
